title: How to help high schoolers prepare for the rise of artificial intelligence
summary: The MIT Abdul Latif Jameel Clinic for Machine Learning in Health held a summer program to educate high school students about the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in healthcare. The program aimed to reach students from diverse backgrounds and offered courses on Python, clinical AI, and drug discovery. The program was made possible through a generous donation and aimed to reduce financial barriers for under-resourced students. The students had the opportunity to interact with MIT faculty and visit local institutions. The program emphasized the intersection of computer science and medicine and aimed to inspire and open new opportunities for the students.
